concept.title: REVOKE
concept.shortdesc: The REVOKE statement allows revoking of any RBAC roles from specific users.

conbody.p:
Roles can be of the following two types:
simple Roles which apply generically to all buckets/resources in the cluster.
For example: ClusterAdmin or BucketAdmin
parameterized by a bucket Roles which are defined for the scope of the specified bucket only. The bucket name is specified after ON.
For example: BucketReader ON `travel-sample`
or Query_Select ON `travel-sample`

p.note: Only Full Administrators can run the REVOKE statement. For more details about user roles, see .

p.codeblock: REVOKE role1 [, role2, ...] ON bucket1 [, bucket2, ...] FROM user1 [, user2, ...]

dlentry.dd: RBAC-role is one of the RBAC role names predefined by Couchbase Server.
RBAC-user is the user name created by the Couchbase Server RBAC system.
The name of your Couchbase or Memcached bucket or buckets.

conbody.p: Example 1: Revoke the role of ClusterAdmin from three people.

p.codeblock: REVOKE ClusterAdmin FROM david, michael, robin

conbody.p: Example 2: Revoke the roles of ClusterAdmin and QueryUpdate in the travel sample bucket from debby.REVOKE ClusterAdmin, QueryUpdate ON `travel-sample` FROM debby
